According to ACLED, from January 1 - March 24, 2018, Fulani ethnic militias have deliberately killed 447 civilians in Nigeria's Middle Belt.  This is part of an ongoing campaign to expel Christian settlers.

417 civilians (mostly Christians) killed by Fulani militias in Nigeria's Middle Belt so far in 2018, according to the ACLED project.  This is part of an ongoing campaign to force Christian farmers out of the Middle Belt, a geographic area of central Nigeria.

The Nigerian government and BH symbiotic relationship depends on money coming into the country from military, NGO and UN-backed initiatives.  Guaranteed 1000 deaths.

Although Islamist groups represent a significant theoretical threat in Nigeria there is little to suggest their gaining sufficient traction to successfully mount a campaign of the magnitude necessary to meet the criteria. There is little evidence either that these groups are strategically valuable to anyone who might conceivably fund them to an extent necessary to do so. There does remain the possibility that displaced Islamists may game the region for diffusion purposes.
